intro: Hieracium substricticaule, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lanceolate leaves that are often reddish underneath. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from June to August. Hieracium substricticaule is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
